Title: Natural variation of Dt2 determines branching in soybean
Summary: Shoot branching is critical in determining soybean yield. Here, the authors report natural variation of Dt2 in controlling soybean branching number and the interaction of Dt2 with GmAgl22 and GmSoc1a to activate transcription of GmAp1a and GmAp1d.

Title: Implantable niche with local immunosuppression for islet allotransplantation achieves type 1 diabetes reversal in rats
Summary: Islet transplantation for type 1 diabetes management is hindered by the life-long need for immunosuppressive medications. Here, the authors report an islet encapsulation device with local anti-rejection drug release that achieves long-term diabetes reversal in male rats and reduces drug-related toxicity.

Title: TAPE-seq is a cell-based method for predicting genome-wide off-target effects of prime editor
Summary: Methods to predict genome-wide off-target activities of prime editors (PEs) are currently lacking. Here the authors report a cell-based assay, TAgmentation of Prime Editor sequencing (TAPE-seq), that provides genome-wide off-target candidates for PEs.

Title: Treatment of peanut allergy and colitis in mice via the intestinal release of butyrate from polymeric micelles
Summary: Intragastrically delivered polymeric micelles releasing butyrate along the intestinal tract restore barrier-protective responses in mouse models of peanut allergy and colitis.

Title: Simultaneous profiling of histone modifications and DNA methylation via nanopore sequencing
Summary: The interplay between histone modifications and DNA methylation plays a crucial role in establishing and maintaining the epigenomic landscape. Here, the authors develop a nanopore sequencing based method for mapping histone modifications and DNA methylation from native, long, single DNA molecules.

Title: Bead-jet printing enabled sparse mesenchymal stem cell patterning augments skeletal muscle and hair follicle regeneration
Summary: Current mesenchymal stem cell (MSC) transplantation practices are limited by the loss or reduced performance of MSCs. Here the authors develop a bead-jet printer for intraoperative formulation and printing of MSCs-laden Matrigel beads to improve skeletal muscle and hair follicle regeneration.

Title: Intravascularly infused extracellular matrix as a biomaterial for targeting and treating inflamed tissues
Summary: Intravascularly infused extracellular matrix from ventricular myocardium binds to leaky vasculature and induces the regeneration of inflamed heart tissue, as shown in rats and pigs.

Title: Polarity and chirality control of an active fluid by passive nematic defects
Summary: Defects of a passive nematic liquid crystal made from actin filaments pattern the collective behaviour of active microtubules, creating macroscopic polar patterns and chiral loops.

Title: Analysis of clinically relevant variants from ancestrally diverse Asian genomes
Summary: Clinically significant genetic variation in Asian populations is under-characterized. Here, the authors show the diversity in prevalence and spectrum of human disease and pharmacogenetic variants in a multi-ethnic Asian population.

Title: High-frequency synthetic apomixis in hybrid rice
Summary: Previously, a proof-of-concept for low frequency synthetic apomixis was established in a laboratory strain of rice by combining MiMe mutations with the egg cell expression of the embryogenic trigger - BBM1. Here, the authors achieve clonal seed formation in hybrid rice with almost full penetrance and higher fertility.
